verses.english: Why do you not believe in Allah while the Messenger is inviting you to have faith in your Lord, although He has already taken your covenant,<sup foot_note=77491>1</sup> if you will ever believe.

verses.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى يُنَزِّلُ عَلَىٰ عَبْدِهِۦٓ ءَايَـٰتٍۭ بَيِّنَـٰتٍ لِّيُخْرِجَكُم مِّنَ ٱلظُّلُمَـٰتِ إِلَى ٱلنُّورِ ۚ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِكُمْ لَرَءُوفٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.english: He is the One Who sends down clear revelations to His servant to bring you out of darkness and into light. For indeed Allah is Ever Gracious and Most Merciful to you.

verses.arabic: وَمَا لَكُمْ أَلَّا تُنفِقُوا۟ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَلِلَّهِ مِيرَٰثُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ لَا يَسْتَوِى مِنكُم مَّنْ أَنفَقَ مِن قَبْلِ ٱلْفَتْحِ وَقَـٰتَلَ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَعْظَمُ دَرَجَةً مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَنفَقُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدُ وَقَـٰتَلُوا۟ ۚ وَكُلًّا وَعَدَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌ
verses.english: And why should you not spend in the cause of Allah, while Allah is the ˹sole˺ inheritor of the heavens and the earth? Those of you who donated and fought before the victory ˹over Mecca˺ are unparalleled. They are far greater in rank than those who donated and fought afterwards.<sup foot_note=77492>1</sup> Yet Allah has promised each a fine reward. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.

verses.arabic: قَدْ سَمِعَ ٱللَّهُ قَوْلَ ٱلَّتِى تُجَـٰدِلُكَ فِى زَوْجِهَا وَتَشْتَكِىٓ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ وَٱللَّهُ يَسْمَعُ تَحَاوُرَكُمَآ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَمِيعٌۢ بَصِيرٌ
verses.english: Indeed, Allah has heard the argument of the woman who pleaded with you ˹O Prophet˺ concerning her husband, and appealed to Allah. Allah has heard your exchange.<sup foot_note=77498>1</sup> Surely Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُظَـٰهِرُونَ مِنكُم مِّن نِّسَآئِهِم مَّا هُنَّ أُمَّهَـٰتِهِمْ ۖ إِنْ أُمَّهَـٰتُهُمْ إِلَّا ٱلَّـٰٓـِٔى وَلَدْنَهُمْ ۚ وَإِنَّهُمْ لَيَقُولُونَ مُنكَرًا مِّنَ ٱلْقَوْلِ وَزُورًا ۚ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَعَفُوٌّ غَفُورٌ
verses.english: Those of you who ˹sinfully˺ divorce their wives by comparing them to their mothers ˹should know that˺ their wives are in no way their mothers. None can be their mothers except those who gave birth to them. What they say is certainly detestable and false. Yet Allah is truly Ever-Pardoning, All-Forgiving.

verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يُظَـٰهِرُونَ مِن نِّسَآئِهِمْ ثُمَّ يَعُودُونَ لِمَا قَالُوا۟ فَتَحْرِيرُ رَقَبَةٍ مِّن قَبْلِ أَن يَتَمَآسَّا ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ تُوعَظُونَ بِهِۦ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌ
verses.english: Those who divorce their wives in this manner, then ˹wish to˺ retract what they said, must free a slave before they touch each other. This ˹penalty˺ is meant to deter you. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.

verses.arabic: فَمَن لَّمْ يَجِدْ فَصِيَامُ شَهْرَيْنِ مُتَتَابِعَيْنِ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يَتَمَآسَّا ۖ فَمَن لَّمْ يَسْتَطِعْ فَإِطْعَامُ سِتِّينَ مِسْكِينًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِتُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ ۚ وَتِلْكَ حُدُودُ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَلِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.english: But if the husband cannot afford this, let him then fast two consecutive months before the couple touch each other. But if he is unable ˹to fast˺, then let him feed sixty poor people. This is to re-affirm your faith in Allah and His Messenger. These are the limits set by Allah. And the disbelievers will suffer a painful punishment.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يُحَآدُّونَ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ كُبِتُوا۟ كَمَا كُبِتَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ وَقَدْ أَنزَلْنَآ ءَايَـٰتٍۭ بَيِّنَـٰتٍ ۚ وَلِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ عَذَابٌ مُّهِينٌ
verses.english: Indeed, those who defy Allah and His Messenger will be debased, just like those before them. We have certainly sent down clear revelations. And the disbelievers will suffer a humiliating punishment.

verses.arabic: يَوْمَ يَبْعَثُهُمُ ٱللَّهُ جَمِيعًا فَيُنَبِّئُهُم بِمَا عَمِلُوٓا۟ ۚ أَحْصَىٰهُ ٱللَّهُ وَنَسُوهُ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ شَهِيدٌ
verses.english: On the Day Allah resurrects them all together, He will then inform them of what they have done. Allah has kept account of it all, while they have forgotten it. For Allah is a Witness over all things.

verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ مَا يَكُونُ مِن نَّجْوَىٰ ثَلَـٰثَةٍ إِلَّا هُوَ رَابِعُهُمْ وَلَا خَمْسَةٍ إِلَّا هُوَ سَادِسُهُمْ وَلَآ أَدْنَىٰ مِن ذَٰلِكَ وَلَآ أَكْثَرَ إِلَّا هُوَ مَعَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كَانُوا۟ ۖ ثُمَّ يُنَبِّئُهُم بِمَا عَمِلُوا۟ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
verses.english: Do you not see that Allah knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth? If three converse privately, He is their fourth. If five, He is their sixth. Whether fewer or more, He is with them<sup foot_note=77499>1</sup> wherever they may be. Then, on the Day of Judgment, He will inform them of what they have done. Surely Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things.

verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى ٱلَّذِينَ نُهُوا۟ عَنِ ٱلنَّجْوَىٰ ثُمَّ يَعُودُونَ لِمَا نُهُوا۟ عَنْهُ وَيَتَنَـٰجَوْنَ بِٱلْإِثْمِ وَٱلْعُدْوَٰنِ وَمَعْصِيَتِ ٱلرَّسُولِ وَإِذَا جَآءُوكَ حَيَّوْكَ بِمَا لَمْ يُحَيِّكَ بِهِ ٱللَّهُ وَيَقُولُونَ فِىٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ لَوْلَا يُعَذِّبُنَا ٱللَّهُ بِمَا نَقُولُ ۚ حَسْبُهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ يَصْلَوْنَهَا ۖ فَبِئْسَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
verses.english: Have you not seen those who were forbidden from secret talks, yet they ˹always˺ return to what they were forbidden from, conspiring in sin, aggression, and disobedience to the Messenger? And when they come to you ˹O Prophet˺, they greet you not as Allah greets you,<sup foot_note=77500>1</sup> and say to one another, “Why does Allah not punish us for what we say?” Hell is enough for them—they will burn in it. And what an evil destination!

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِذَا تَنَـٰجَيْتُمْ فَلَا تَتَنَـٰجَوْا۟ بِٱلْإِثْمِ وَٱلْعُدْوَٰنِ وَمَعْصِيَتِ ٱلرَّسُولِ وَتَنَـٰجَوْا۟ بِٱلْبِرِّ وَٱلتَّقْوَىٰ ۖ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ٱلَّذِىٓ إِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ
verses.english: O believers! When you converse privately, let it not be for sin, aggression, or disobedience to the Messenger, but let it be for goodness and righteousness. And fear Allah, to Whom you will ˹all˺ be gathered.

verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا ٱلنَّجْوَىٰ مِنَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنِ لِيَحْزُنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَلَيْسَ بِضَآرِّهِمْ شَيْـًٔا إِلَّا بِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَعَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.english: Secret talks are only inspired by Satan to grieve the believers. Yet he cannot harm them whatsoever except by Allah’s Will. So in Allah let the believers put their trust.

verses.arabic: سَبَّحَ لِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
verses.english: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth glorifies Allah. For He is the Almighty, All-Wise.

verses.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَخْرَجَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ مِن دِيَـٰرِهِمْ لِأَوَّلِ ٱلْحَشْرِ ۚ مَا ظَنَنتُمْ أَن يَخْرُجُوا۟ ۖ وَظَنُّوٓا۟ أَنَّهُم مَّانِعَتُهُمْ حُصُونُهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ فَأَتَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَمْ يَحْتَسِبُوا۟ ۖ وَقَذَفَ فِى قُلُوبِهِمُ ٱلرُّعْبَ ۚ يُخْرِبُونَ بُيُوتَهُم بِأَيْدِيهِمْ وَأَيْدِى ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ فَٱعْتَبِرُوا۟ يَـٰٓأُو۟لِى ٱلْأَبْصَـٰرِ
verses.english: He is the One Who expelled the disbelievers of the People of the Book from their homes for ˹their˺ first banishment ˹ever˺. You never thought they would go. And they thought their strongholds would put them out of Allah’s reach. But ˹the decree of˺ Allah came upon them from where they never expected. And He cast horror into their hearts so they destroyed their houses with their own hands and the hands of the believers.<sup foot_note=77502>1</sup> So take a lesson ˹from this˺, O  people of insight!

verses.arabic: وَلَوْلَآ أَن كَتَبَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْجَلَآءَ لَعَذَّبَهُمْ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَلَهُمْ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ عَذَابُ ٱلنَّارِ
verses.english: Had Allah not decreed exile for them, He would have certainly punished them in this world. And in the Hereafter they will suffer the punishment of the Fire.

verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ شَآقُّوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ ۖ وَمَن يُشَآقِّ ٱللَّهَ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ شَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
verses.english: This is because they defied Allah and His Messenger. And whoever defies Allah, then Allah is truly severe in punishment.

verses.arabic: مَا قَطَعْتُم مِّن لِّينَةٍ أَوْ تَرَكْتُمُوهَا قَآئِمَةً عَلَىٰٓ أُصُولِهَا فَبِإِذْنِ ٱللَّهِ وَلِيُخْزِىَ ٱلْفَـٰسِقِينَ
verses.english: Whatever palm trees you ˹believers˺ cut down or left standing intact, it was ˹all˺ by Allah’s Will, so that He might disgrace the rebellious.<sup foot_note=77503>1</sup>

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَفَآءَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ رَسُولِهِۦ مِنْهُمْ فَمَآ أَوْجَفْتُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ خَيْلٍ وَلَا رِكَابٍ وَلَـٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُسَلِّطُ رُسُلَهُۥ عَلَىٰ مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.english: As for the gains Allah has turned over to His Messenger from them—you did not ˹even˺ spur on any horse or camel for such gains. But Allah gives authority to His messengers over whoever He wills. For Allah is Most Capable of everything.

verses.arabic: مَّآ أَفَآءَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ رَسُولِهِۦ مِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْقُرَىٰ فَلِلَّهِ وَلِلرَّسُولِ وَلِذِى ٱلْقُرْبَىٰ وَٱلْيَتَـٰمَىٰ وَٱلْمَسَـٰكِينِ وَٱبْنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ كَىْ لَا يَكُونَ دُولَةًۢ بَيْنَ ٱلْأَغْنِيَآءِ مِنكُمْ ۚ وَمَآ ءَاتَىٰكُمُ ٱلرَّسُولُ فَخُذُوهُ وَمَا نَهَىٰكُمْ عَنْهُ فَٱنتَهُوا۟ ۚ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ شَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
verses.english: As for gains granted by Allah to His Messenger from the people of ˹other˺ lands, they are for Allah and the Messenger, his close relatives, orphans, the poor, and ˹needy˺ travellers so that wealth may not merely circulate among your rich. Whatever the Messenger gives you, take it. And whatever he forbids you from, leave it. And fear Allah. Surely Allah is severe in punishment.

verses.arabic: لِلْفُقَرَآءِ ٱلْمُهَـٰجِرِينَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُخْرِجُوا۟ مِن دِيَـٰرِهِمْ وَأَمْوَٰلِهِمْ يَبْتَغُونَ فَضْلًا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِضْوَٰنًا وَيَنصُرُونَ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥٓ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلصَّـٰدِقُونَ
verses.english: ˹Some of the gains will be˺ for poor emigrants who were driven out of their homes and wealth, seeking Allah’s bounty and pleasure, and standing up for Allah and His Messenger. They are the ones true in faith.

verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ تَبَوَّءُو ٱلدَّارَ وَٱلْإِيمَـٰنَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ يُحِبُّونَ مَنْ هَاجَرَ إِلَيْهِمْ وَلَا يَجِدُونَ فِى صُدُورِهِمْ حَاجَةً مِّمَّآ أُوتُوا۟ وَيُؤْثِرُونَ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَلَوْ كَانَ بِهِمْ خَصَاصَةٌ ۚ وَمَن يُوقَ شُحَّ نَفْسِهِۦ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْلِحُونَ
verses.english: As for those who had settled in the city and ˹embraced˺ the faith before ˹the arrival of˺ the emigrants, they love whoever immigrates to them, never having a desire in their hearts for whatever ˹of the gains˺ is given to the emigrants. They give ˹the emigrants˺ preference over themselves even though they may be in need. And whoever is saved from the selfishness of their own souls, it is they who are ˹truly˺ successful.

verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ جَآءُو مِنۢ بَعْدِهِمْ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا ٱغْفِرْ لَنَا وَلِإِخْوَٰنِنَا ٱلَّذِينَ سَبَقُونَا بِٱلْإِيمَـٰنِ وَلَا تَجْعَلْ فِى قُلُوبِنَا غِلًّا لِّلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ رَءُوفٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.english: And those who come after them will pray, “Our Lord! Forgive us and our fellow believers who preceded us in faith, and do not allow bitterness into our hearts towards those who believe. Our Lord! Indeed, You are Ever Gracious, Most Merciful.”

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تَتَّخِذُوا۟ عَدُوِّى وَعَدُوَّكُمْ أَوْلِيَآءَ تُلْقُونَ إِلَيْهِم بِٱلْمَوَدَّةِ وَقَدْ كَفَرُوا۟ بِمَا جَآءَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْحَقِّ يُخْرِجُونَ ٱلرَّسُولَ وَإِيَّاكُمْ ۙ أَن تُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ رَبِّكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ خَرَجْتُمْ جِهَـٰدًا فِى سَبِيلِى وَٱبْتِغَآءَ مَرْضَاتِى ۚ تُسِرُّونَ إِلَيْهِم بِٱلْمَوَدَّةِ وَأَنَا۠ أَعْلَمُ بِمَآ أَخْفَيْتُمْ وَمَآ أَعْلَنتُمْ ۚ وَمَن يَفْعَلْهُ مِنكُمْ فَقَدْ ضَلَّ سَوَآءَ ٱلسَّبِيلِ
verses.english: O believers! Do not take My enemies and yours as trusted allies, showing them affection even though they deny what has come to you of the truth. They drove the Messenger and yourselves out ˹of Mecca˺, simply for your belief in Allah, your Lord. If you ˹truly˺ emigrated<sup foot_note=77510>1</sup> to struggle in My cause and seek My pleasure, ˹then do not take them as allies,˺ disclosing secrets ˹of the believers˺ to the pagans out of affection for them, when I know best whatever you conceal and whatever you reveal. And whoever of you does this has truly strayed from the Right Way.

verses.arabic: إِن يَثْقَفُوكُمْ يَكُونُوا۟ لَكُمْ أَعْدَآءً وَيَبْسُطُوٓا۟ إِلَيْكُمْ أَيْدِيَهُمْ وَأَلْسِنَتَهُم بِٱلسُّوٓءِ وَوَدُّوا۟ لَوْ تَكْفُرُونَ
verses.english: If they gain the upper hand over you, they would be your ˹open˺ enemies, unleashing their hands and tongues to harm you, and wishing that you would abandon faith.

verses.arabic: لَن تَنفَعَكُمْ أَرْحَامُكُمْ وَلَآ أَوْلَـٰدُكُمْ ۚ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ يَفْصِلُ بَيْنَكُمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ
verses.english: Neither your relatives nor children will benefit you on Judgment Day—He will decide between you ˹all˺. For Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.

verses.arabic: قَدْ كَانَتْ لَكُمْ أُسْوَةٌ حَسَنَةٌ فِىٓ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَٱلَّذِينَ مَعَهُۥٓ إِذْ قَالُوا۟ لِقَوْمِهِمْ إِنَّا بُرَءَٰٓؤُا۟ مِنكُمْ وَمِمَّا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ كَفَرْنَا بِكُمْ وَبَدَا بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَكُمُ ٱلْعَدَٰوَةُ وَٱلْبَغْضَآءُ أَبَدًا حَتَّىٰ تُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَحْدَهُۥٓ إِلَّا قَوْلَ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ لِأَبِيهِ لَأَسْتَغْفِرَنَّ لَكَ وَمَآ أَمْلِكُ لَكَ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن شَىْءٍ ۖ رَّبَّنَا عَلَيْكَ تَوَكَّلْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ أَنَبْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
verses.english: You already have an excellent example in Abraham and those with him, when they said to their people, “We totally dissociate ourselves from you and ˹shun˺ whatever ˹idols˺ you worship besides Allah. We reject you. The enmity and hatred that has arisen between us and you will last until you believe in Allah alone.” The only exception is when Abraham said to his father, “I will seek forgiveness for you,˹” adding, “but˺ I cannot protect you from Allah at all.” ˹The believers prayed,˺ “Our Lord! In You we trust. And to You we ˹always˺ turn. And to You is the final return.

verses.arabic: رَبَّنَا لَا تَجْعَلْنَا فِتْنَةً لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا رَبَّنَآ ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
verses.english: Our Lord! Do not subject us to the persecution of the disbelievers. Forgive us, our Lord! You ˹alone˺ are truly the Almighty, All-Wise.”

verses.arabic: لَقَدْ كَانَ لَكُمْ فِيهِمْ أُسْوَةٌ حَسَنَةٌ لِّمَن كَانَ يَرْجُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱلْيَوْمَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَ ۚ وَمَن يَتَوَلَّ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلْغَنِىُّ ٱلْحَمِيدُ
verses.english: You certainly have an excellent example in them for whoever has hope in Allah and the Last Day. But whoever turns away, then surely Allah ˹alone˺ is the Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy.

verses.arabic: ۞ عَسَى ٱللَّهُ أَن يَجْعَلَ بَيْنَكُمْ وَبَيْنَ ٱلَّذِينَ عَادَيْتُم مِّنْهُم مَّوَدَّةً ۚ وَٱللَّهُ قَدِيرٌ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.english: ˹In time,˺ Allah may bring about goodwill between you and those of them you ˹now˺ hold as enemies. For Allah is Most Capable. And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

verses.arabic: لَّا يَنْهَىٰكُمُ ٱللَّهُ عَنِ ٱلَّذِينَ لَمْ يُقَـٰتِلُوكُمْ فِى ٱلدِّينِ وَلَمْ يُخْرِجُوكُم مِّن دِيَـٰرِكُمْ أَن تَبَرُّوهُمْ وَتُقْسِطُوٓا۟ إِلَيْهِمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُقْسِطِينَ
verses.english: Allah does not forbid you from dealing kindly and fairly with those who have neither fought nor driven you out of your homes. Surely Allah loves those who are fair.

verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا يَنْهَىٰكُمُ ٱللَّهُ عَنِ ٱلَّذِينَ قَـٰتَلُوكُمْ فِى ٱلدِّينِ وَأَخْرَجُوكُم مِّن دِيَـٰرِكُمْ وَظَـٰهَرُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ إِخْرَاجِكُمْ أَن تَوَلَّوْهُمْ ۚ وَمَن يَتَوَلَّهُمْ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ
verses.english: Allah only forbids you from befriending those who have fought you for ˹your˺ faith, driven you out of your homes, or supported ˹others˺ in doing so. And whoever takes them as friends, then it is they who are the ˹true˺ wrongdoers.

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِذَا جَآءَكُمُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنَـٰتُ مُهَـٰجِرَٰتٍ فَٱمْتَحِنُوهُنَّ ۖ ٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِإِيمَـٰنِهِنَّ ۖ فَإِنْ عَلِمْتُمُوهُنَّ مُؤْمِنَـٰتٍ فَلَا تَرْجِعُوهُنَّ إِلَى ٱلْكُفَّارِ ۖ لَا هُنَّ حِلٌّ لَّهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحِلُّونَ لَهُنَّ ۖ وَءَاتُوهُم مَّآ أَنفَقُوا۟ ۚ وَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَيْكُمْ أَن تَنكِحُوهُنَّ إِذَآ ءَاتَيْتُمُوهُنَّ أُجُورَهُنَّ ۚ وَلَا تُمْسِكُوا۟ بِعِصَمِ ٱلْكَوَافِرِ وَسْـَٔلُوا۟ مَآ أَنفَقْتُمْ وَلْيَسْـَٔلُوا۟ مَآ أَنفَقُوا۟ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ حُكْمُ ٱللَّهِ ۖ يَحْكُمُ بَيْنَكُمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.english: O believers! When the believing women come to you as emigrants,<sup foot_note=77511>1</sup> test their intentions—their faith is best known to Allah—and if you find them to be believers, then do not send them back to the disbelievers. These ˹women˺ are not lawful ˹wives˺ for the disbelievers, nor are the disbelievers lawful ˹husbands˺ for them. ˹But˺ repay the disbelievers whatever ˹dowries˺ they had paid. And there is no blame on you if you marry these ˹women˺ as long as you pay them their dowries. And do not hold on to marriage with polytheistic women.<sup foot_note=77512>2</sup> ˹But˺ demand ˹repayment of˺ whatever ˹dowries˺ you had paid, and let the disbelievers do the same. That is the judgment of Allah—He judges between you. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

verses.arabic: سَبَّحَ لِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
verses.english: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth glorifies Allah. For He ˹alone˺ is the Almighty, All-Wise.

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لِمَ تَقُولُونَ مَا لَا تَفْعَلُونَ
verses.english: O believers! Why do you say what you do not do?

verses.arabic: كَبُرَ مَقْتًا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ أَن تَقُولُوا۟ مَا لَا تَفْعَلُونَ
verses.english: How despicable it is in the sight of Allah that you say what you do not do!

verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحِبُّ ٱلَّذِينَ يُقَـٰتِلُونَ فِى سَبِيلِهِۦ صَفًّا كَأَنَّهُم بُنْيَـٰنٌ مَّرْصُوصٌ
verses.english: Surely Allah loves those who fight in His cause in ˹solid˺ ranks as if they were one concrete structure.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِۦ يَـٰقَوْمِ لِمَ تُؤْذُونَنِى وَقَد تَّعْلَمُونَ أَنِّى رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ إِلَيْكُمْ ۖ فَلَمَّا زَاغُوٓا۟ أَزَاغَ ٱللَّهُ قُلُوبَهُمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلْفَـٰسِقِينَ
verses.english: ˹Remember, O  Prophet,˺ when Moses said to his people, “O my people! Why do you hurt me when you already know I am Allah’s messenger to you?” So when they ˹persistently˺ deviated, Allah caused their hearts to deviate. For Allah does not guide the rebellious people.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ عِيسَى ٱبْنُ مَرْيَمَ يَـٰبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ إِنِّى رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ إِلَيْكُم مُّصَدِّقًا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَىَّ مِنَ ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةِ وَمُبَشِّرًۢا بِرَسُولٍ يَأْتِى مِنۢ بَعْدِى ٱسْمُهُۥٓ أَحْمَدُ ۖ فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ قَالُوا۟ هَـٰذَا سِحْرٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.english: And ˹remember˺ when Jesus, son of Mary, said, “O children of Israel! I am truly Allah’s messenger to you, confirming the Torah which came before me, and giving good news of a messenger after me whose name will be Aḥmad.”<sup foot_note=77514>1</sup> Yet when the Prophet came to them with clear proofs, they said, “This is pure magic.”

verses.arabic: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْكَذِبَ وَهُوَ يُدْعَىٰٓ إِلَى ٱلْإِسْلَـٰمِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
verses.english: Who does more wrong than the one who fabricates lies about Allah when invited to submit ˹to Him˺?<sup foot_note=77515>1</sup> For Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

verses.arabic: يُرِيدُونَ لِيُطْفِـُٔوا۟ نُورَ ٱللَّهِ بِأَفْوَٰهِهِمْ وَٱللَّهُ مُتِمُّ نُورِهِۦ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ
verses.english: They wish to extinguish Allah’s light with their mouths, but Allah will ˹certainly˺ perfect His light, even to the dismay of the disbelievers.

verses.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَرْسَلَ رَسُولَهُۥ بِٱلْهُدَىٰ وَدِينِ ٱلْحَقِّ لِيُظْهِرَهُۥ عَلَى ٱلدِّينِ كُلِّهِۦ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ ٱلْمُشْرِكُونَ
verses.english: He is the One Who has sent His Messenger with ˹true˺ guidance and the religion of truth, making it prevail over all others, even to the dismay of the polytheists.

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ هَلْ أَدُلُّكُمْ عَلَىٰ تِجَـٰرَةٍ تُنجِيكُم مِّنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
verses.english: O believers! Shall I guide you to an exchange that will save you from a painful punishment?

verses.arabic: يُسَبِّحُ لِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ٱلْمَلِكِ ٱلْقُدُّوسِ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْحَكِيمِ
verses.english: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth ˹constantly˺ glorifies Allah—the King, the Most Holy, the Almighty, the All-Wise.

verses.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى بَعَثَ فِى ٱلْأُمِّيِّـۧنَ رَسُولًا مِّنْهُمْ يَتْلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ وَيُزَكِّيهِمْ وَيُعَلِّمُهُمُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلْحِكْمَةَ وَإِن كَانُوا۟ مِن قَبْلُ لَفِى ضَلَـٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.english: He is the One Who raised for the illiterate ˹people˺ a messenger from among themselves—reciting to them His revelations, purifying them, and teaching them the Book and wisdom, for indeed they had previously been clearly astray—

verses.arabic: وَءَاخَرِينَ مِنْهُمْ لَمَّا يَلْحَقُوا۟ بِهِمْ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
verses.english: along with others of them who have not yet joined them ˹in faith˺. For He is the Almighty, All-Wise.

verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ فَضْلُ ٱللَّهِ يُؤْتِيهِ مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو ٱلْفَضْلِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
verses.english: This is the favour of Allah. He grants it to whoever He wills. And Allah is the Lord of infinite bounty.

verses.arabic: مَثَلُ ٱلَّذِينَ حُمِّلُوا۟ ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةَ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَحْمِلُوهَا كَمَثَلِ ٱلْحِمَارِ يَحْمِلُ أَسْفَارًۢا ۚ بِئْسَ مَثَلُ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
verses.english: The example of those who were entrusted with ˹observing˺ the Torah but failed to do so, is that of a donkey carrying books.<sup foot_note=77516>1</sup> How evil is the example of those who reject Allah’s signs! For Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

verses.arabic: قُلْ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ هَادُوٓا۟ إِن زَعَمْتُمْ أَنَّكُمْ أَوْلِيَآءُ لِلَّهِ مِن دُونِ ٱلنَّاسِ فَتَمَنَّوُا۟ ٱلْمَوْتَ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
verses.english: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “O Jews! If you claim to be Allah’s chosen ˹people˺ out of all humanity, then wish for death, if what you say is true.”

verses.arabic: وَلَا يَتَمَنَّوْنَهُۥٓ أَبَدًۢا بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌۢ بِٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
verses.english: But they will never wish for that because of what their hands have done.<sup foot_note=77517>1</sup> And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of the wrongdoers.

verses.arabic: قُلْ إِنَّ ٱلْمَوْتَ ٱلَّذِى تَفِرُّونَ مِنْهُ فَإِنَّهُۥ مُلَـٰقِيكُمْ ۖ ثُمَّ تُرَدُّونَ إِلَىٰ عَـٰلِمِ ٱلْغَيْبِ وَٱلشَّهَـٰدَةِ فَيُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.english: Say, “The death you are running away from will inevitably come to you. Then you will be returned to the Knower of the seen and unseen, and He will inform you of what you used to do.”

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِذَا نُودِىَ لِلصَّلَوٰةِ مِن يَوْمِ ٱلْجُمُعَةِ فَٱسْعَوْا۟ إِلَىٰ ذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ وَذَرُوا۟ ٱلْبَيْعَ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌ لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.english: O believers! When the call to prayer is made on Friday, then proceed ˹diligently˺ to the remembrance of Allah and leave off ˹your˺ business. That is best for you, if only you knew.

verses.arabic: فَإِذَا قُضِيَتِ ٱلصَّلَوٰةُ فَٱنتَشِرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَٱبْتَغُوا۟ مِن فَضْلِ ٱللَّهِ وَٱذْكُرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرًا لَّعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
verses.english: Once the prayer is over, disperse throughout the land and seek the bounty of Allah. And remember Allah often so you may be successful.

verses.arabic: إِذَا جَآءَكَ ٱلْمُنَـٰفِقُونَ قَالُوا۟ نَشْهَدُ إِنَّكَ لَرَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ إِنَّكَ لَرَسُولُهُۥ وَٱللَّهُ يَشْهَدُ إِنَّ ٱلْمُنَـٰفِقِينَ لَكَـٰذِبُونَ
verses.english: When the hypocrites come to you ˹O Prophet˺, they say, “We bear witness that you are certainly the Messenger of Allah”—and surely Allah knows that you are His Messenger—but Allah bears witness that the hypocrites are truly liars.

verses.arabic: ٱتَّخَذُوٓا۟ أَيْمَـٰنَهُمْ جُنَّةً فَصَدُّوا۟ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ سَآءَ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.english: They have made their ˹false˺ oaths as a shield, hindering ˹others˺ from the Way of Allah. Evil indeed is what they do!

verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ ءَامَنُوا۟ ثُمَّ كَفَرُوا۟ فَطُبِعَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ فَهُمْ لَا يَفْقَهُونَ
verses.english: This is because they believed and then abandoned faith. Therefore, their hearts have been sealed, so they do not comprehend.

verses.arabic: ۞ وَإِذَا رَأَيْتَهُمْ تُعْجِبُكَ أَجْسَامُهُمْ ۖ وَإِن يَقُولُوا۟ تَسْمَعْ لِقَوْلِهِمْ ۖ كَأَنَّهُمْ خُشُبٌ مُّسَنَّدَةٌ ۖ يَحْسَبُونَ كُلَّ صَيْحَةٍ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ هُمُ ٱلْعَدُوُّ فَٱحْذَرْهُمْ ۚ قَـٰتَلَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ ۖ أَنَّىٰ يُؤْفَكُونَ
verses.english: When you see them, their appearance impresses you. And when they speak, you listen to their ˹impressive˺ speech. But they are ˹just˺ like ˹worthless˺ planks of wood leaned ˹against a wall˺. They think every cry is against them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. May Allah condemn them! How can they be deluded ˹from the truth˺?

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ تَعَالَوْا۟ يَسْتَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ لَوَّوْا۟ رُءُوسَهُمْ وَرَأَيْتَهُمْ يَصُدُّونَ وَهُم مُّسْتَكْبِرُونَ
verses.english: When it is said to them, “Come! The Messenger of Allah will pray for you to be forgiven,” they turn their heads ˹in disgust˺, and you see them ˹O Prophet˺ turn away in arrogance.

verses.arabic: سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْهِمْ أَسْتَغْفَرْتَ لَهُمْ أَمْ لَمْ تَسْتَغْفِرْ لَهُمْ لَن يَغْفِرَ ٱللَّهُ لَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلْفَـٰسِقِينَ
verses.english: It is the same whether you pray for their forgiveness or not, Allah will not forgive them. Surely Allah does not guide the rebellious people.

verses.arabic: هُمُ ٱلَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ لَا تُنفِقُوا۟ عَلَىٰ مَنْ عِندَ رَسُولِ ٱللَّهِ حَتَّىٰ يَنفَضُّوا۟ ۗ وَلِلَّهِ خَزَآئِنُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ ٱلْمُنَـٰفِقِينَ لَا يَفْقَهُونَ
verses.english: They are the ones who say ˹to one another˺, “Do not spend ˹anything˺ on those ˹emigrants˺ with the Messenger of Allah so that they will break away ˹from him˺.” But to Allah ˹alone˺ belong the treasuries of the heavens and the earth, yet the hypocrites do not comprehend.

verses.arabic: يَقُولُونَ لَئِن رَّجَعْنَآ إِلَى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ لَيُخْرِجَنَّ ٱلْأَعَزُّ مِنْهَا ٱلْأَذَلَّ ۚ وَلِلَّهِ ٱلْعِزَّةُ وَلِرَسُولِهِۦ وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَلَـٰكِنَّ ٱلْمُنَـٰفِقِينَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.english: They say, “If we return to Medina, the honourable will definitely expel the inferior.” But all honour and power belongs to Allah, His Messenger, and the believers, yet the hypocrites do not know.

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تُلْهِكُمْ أَمْوَٰلُكُمْ وَلَآ أَوْلَـٰدُكُمْ عَن ذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَمَن يَفْعَلْ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْخَـٰسِرُونَ
verses.english: O believers! Do not let your wealth or your children divert you from the remembrance of Allah. For whoever does so, it is they who are the ˹true˺ losers.

verses.arabic: وَأَنفِقُوا۟ مِن مَّا رَزَقْنَـٰكُم مِّن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِىَ أَحَدَكُمُ ٱلْمَوْتُ فَيَقُولَ رَبِّ لَوْلَآ أَخَّرْتَنِىٓ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍ قَرِيبٍ فَأَصَّدَّقَ وَأَكُن مِّنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
verses.english: And donate from what We have provided for you before death comes to one of you, and you cry, “My Lord! If only You delayed me for a short while, I would give in charity and be one of the righteous.”

verses.arabic: يُسَبِّحُ لِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ لَهُ ٱلْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ ٱلْحَمْدُ ۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.english: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth ˹constantly˺ glorifies Allah. The kingdom is His, and all praise is for Him. For He is Most Capable of everything.

verses.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكُمْ فَمِنكُمْ كَافِرٌ وَمِنكُم مُّؤْمِنٌ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ
verses.english: He is the One Who created you, yet some of you are disbelievers while some are believers. And Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.

verses.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَصَوَّرَكُمْ فَأَحْسَنَ صُوَرَكُمْ ۖ وَإِلَيْهِ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
verses.english: He created the heavens and the earth for a purpose. He shaped you ˹in the womb˺, perfecting your form. And to Him is the final return.

verses.arabic: يَعْلَمُ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُسِرُّونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
verses.english: He knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth. And He knows whatever you conceal and whatever you reveal. For Allah knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart.

verses.arabic: أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ نَبَؤُا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن قَبْلُ فَذَاقُوا۟ وَبَالَ أَمْرِهِمْ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.english: Have the stories of those who disbelieved before not reached you ˹pagans˺? They tasted the evil consequences of their doings, and they will suffer a painful punishment.

verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُۥ كَانَت تَّأْتِيهِمْ رُسُلُهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ فَقَالُوٓا۟ أَبَشَرٌ يَهْدُونَنَا فَكَفَرُوا۟ وَتَوَلَّوا۟ ۚ وَّٱسْتَغْنَى ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَنِىٌّ حَمِيدٌ
verses.english: That was because their messengers used to come to them with clear proofs, but they said ˹mockingly˺, “How can humans be our guides?” So they persisted in disbelief and turned away. And Allah was not in need ˹of their faith˺. For Allah is Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy.

verses.arabic: زَعَمَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَن لَّن يُبْعَثُوا۟ ۚ قُلْ بَلَىٰ وَرَبِّى لَتُبْعَثُنَّ ثُمَّ لَتُنَبَّؤُنَّ بِمَا عَمِلْتُمْ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ يَسِيرٌ
verses.english: The disbelievers claim they will not be resurrected. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Yes, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected, then you will certainly be informed of what you have done. And that is easy for Allah.”

verses.arabic: فَـَٔامِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ وَٱلنُّورِ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنزَلْنَا ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌ
verses.english: So believe in Allah and His Messenger and in the Light<sup foot_note=77518>1</sup> We have revealed. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.

verses.arabic: يَوْمَ يَجْمَعُكُمْ لِيَوْمِ ٱلْجَمْعِ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ ٱلتَّغَابُنِ ۗ وَمَن يُؤْمِنۢ بِٱللَّهِ وَيَعْمَلْ صَـٰلِحًا يُكَفِّرْ عَنْهُ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِۦ وَيُدْخِلْهُ جَنَّـٰتٍ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْعَظِيمُ
verses.english: ˹Consider˺ the Day He will gather you ˹all˺ for the Day of Gathering—that will be the Day of mutual loss and gain. So whoever believes in Allah and does good, He will absolve them of their sins and admit them into Gardens under which rivers flow, to stay there for ever and ever. That is the ultimate triumph.

verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَكَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۖ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
verses.english: As for those who disbelieve and reject Our revelations, they will be the residents of the Fire, staying there forever. What an evil destination!

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ إِذَا طَلَّقْتُمُ ٱلنِّسَآءَ فَطَلِّقُوهُنَّ لِعِدَّتِهِنَّ وَأَحْصُوا۟ ٱلْعِدَّةَ ۖ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ رَبَّكُمْ ۖ لَا تُخْرِجُوهُنَّ مِنۢ بُيُوتِهِنَّ وَلَا يَخْرُجْنَ إِلَّآ أَن يَأْتِينَ بِفَـٰحِشَةٍ مُّبَيِّنَةٍ ۚ وَتِلْكَ حُدُودُ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَمَن يَتَعَدَّ حُدُودَ ٱللَّهِ فَقَدْ ظَلَمَ نَفْسَهُۥ ۚ لَا تَدْرِى لَعَلَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحْدِثُ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ أَمْرًا
verses.english: O Prophet! ˹Instruct the believers:˺ When you ˹intend to˺ divorce women, then divorce them with concern for their waiting period,<sup foot_note=77520>1</sup> and count it accurately. And fear Allah, your Lord. Do not force them out of their homes, nor should they leave—unless they commit a blatant misconduct. These are the limits set by Allah. And whoever transgresses Allah’s limits has truly wronged his own soul. You never know, perhaps Allah will bring about a change ˹of heart˺ later.<sup foot_note=77521>2</sup>

verses.arabic: فَإِذَا بَلَغْنَ أَجَلَهُنَّ فَأَمْسِكُوهُنَّ بِمَعْرُوفٍ أَوْ فَارِقُوهُنَّ بِمَعْرُوفٍ وَأَشْهِدُوا۟ ذَوَىْ عَدْلٍ مِّنكُمْ وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلشَّهَـٰدَةَ لِلَّهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ يُوعَظُ بِهِۦ مَن كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرِ ۚ وَمَن يَتَّقِ ٱللَّهَ يَجْعَل لَّهُۥ مَخْرَجًا
verses.english: Then when they have ˹almost˺ reached the end of their waiting period, either retain them honourably or separate from them honourably.<sup foot_note=77522>1</sup> And call two of your reliable men to witness ˹either way˺—and ˹let the witnesses˺ bear true testimony for ˹the sake of˺ Allah. This is enjoined on whoever has faith in Allah and the Last Day. And whoever is mindful of Allah, He will make a way out for them,

verses.arabic: وَيَرْزُقْهُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَحْتَسِبُ ۚ وَمَن يَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَهُوَ حَسْبُهُۥٓ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بَـٰلِغُ أَمْرِهِۦ ۚ قَدْ جَعَلَ ٱللَّهُ لِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدْرًا
verses.english: and provide for them from sources they could never imagine. And whoever puts their trust in Allah, then He ˹alone˺ is sufficient for them. Certainly Allah achieves His Will. Allah has already set a destiny for everything.

verses.arabic: وَٱلَّـٰٓـِٔى يَئِسْنَ مِنَ ٱلْمَحِيضِ مِن نِّسَآئِكُمْ إِنِ ٱرْتَبْتُمْ فَعِدَّتُهُنَّ ثَلَـٰثَةُ أَشْهُرٍ وَٱلَّـٰٓـِٔى لَمْ يَحِضْنَ ۚ وَأُو۟لَـٰتُ ٱلْأَحْمَالِ أَجَلُهُنَّ أَن يَضَعْنَ حَمْلَهُنَّ ۚ وَمَن يَتَّقِ ٱللَّهَ يَجْعَل لَّهُۥ مِنْ أَمْرِهِۦ يُسْرًا
verses.english: As for your women past the age of menstruation, in case you do not know, their waiting period is three months, and those who have not menstruated as well. As for those who are pregnant, their waiting period ends with delivery.<sup foot_note=77523>1</sup> And whoever is mindful of Allah, He will make their matters easy for them.

verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ أَمْرُ ٱللَّهِ أَنزَلَهُۥٓ إِلَيْكُمْ ۚ وَمَن يَتَّقِ ٱللَّهَ يُكَفِّرْ عَنْهُ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِۦ وَيُعْظِمْ لَهُۥٓ أَجْرًا
verses.english: This is the commandment of Allah, which He has revealed to you. And whoever is mindful of Allah, He will absolve them of their sins and reward them immensely.

verses.arabic: أَسْكِنُوهُنَّ مِنْ حَيْثُ سَكَنتُم مِّن وُجْدِكُمْ وَلَا تُضَآرُّوهُنَّ لِتُضَيِّقُوا۟ عَلَيْهِنَّ ۚ وَإِن كُنَّ أُو۟لَـٰتِ حَمْلٍ فَأَنفِقُوا۟ عَلَيْهِنَّ حَتَّىٰ يَضَعْنَ حَمْلَهُنَّ ۚ فَإِنْ أَرْضَعْنَ لَكُمْ فَـَٔاتُوهُنَّ أُجُورَهُنَّ ۖ وَأْتَمِرُوا۟ بَيْنَكُم بِمَعْرُوفٍ ۖ وَإِن تَعَاسَرْتُمْ فَسَتُرْضِعُ لَهُۥٓ أُخْرَىٰ
verses.english: Let them live where you live ˹during their waiting period˺, according to your means. And do not harass them to make their stay unbearable. If they are pregnant, then maintain them until they deliver. And if they nurse your child,<sup foot_note=77524>1</sup> compensate them, and consult together courteously. But if you fail to reach an agreement, then another woman will nurse ˹the child˺ for the father.

verses.arabic: لِيُنفِقْ ذُو سَعَةٍ مِّن سَعَتِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن قُدِرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقُهُۥ فَلْيُنفِقْ مِمَّآ ءَاتَىٰهُ ٱللَّهُ ۚ لَا يُكَلِّفُ ٱللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا مَآ ءَاتَىٰهَا ۚ سَيَجْعَلُ ٱللَّهُ بَعْدَ عُسْرٍ يُسْرًا
verses.english: Let the man of wealth provide according to his means. As for the one with limited resources, let him provide according to whatever Allah has given him. Allah does not require of any soul beyond what He has given it. After hardship, Allah will bring about ease.

verses.arabic: وَكَأَيِّن مِّن قَرْيَةٍ عَتَتْ عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهَا وَرُسُلِهِۦ فَحَاسَبْنَـٰهَا حِسَابًا شَدِيدًا وَعَذَّبْنَـٰهَا عَذَابًا نُّكْرًا
verses.english: ˹Imagine˺ how many societies rebelled against the commandments of their Lord and His messengers, so We called each ˹society˺ to a severe account and subjected them to a horrible punishment.

verses.arabic: فَذَاقَتْ وَبَالَ أَمْرِهَا وَكَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ أَمْرِهَا خُسْرًا
verses.english: So they tasted the evil consequences of their doings, and the outcome of their doings was ˹total˺ loss.

verses.arabic: أَعَدَّ ٱللَّهُ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا ۖ فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ يَـٰٓأُو۟لِى ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ۚ قَدْ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ إِلَيْكُمْ ذِكْرًا
verses.english: Allah has ˹also˺ prepared for them a severe punishment. So fear Allah, O  people of reason and faith. Allah has indeed revealed to you a Reminder,<sup foot_note=77525>1</sup>

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ لِمَ تُحَرِّمُ مَآ أَحَلَّ ٱللَّهُ لَكَ ۖ تَبْتَغِى مَرْضَاتَ أَزْوَٰجِكَ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.english: O Prophet! Why do you prohibit ˹yourself˺ from what Allah has made lawful to you, seeking to please your wives? And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

verses.arabic: قَدْ فَرَضَ ٱللَّهُ لَكُمْ تَحِلَّةَ أَيْمَـٰنِكُمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ مَوْلَىٰكُمْ ۖ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَلِيمُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
verses.english: Allah has already ordained for you ˹believers˺ the way to absolve yourselves from your oaths.<sup foot_note=77526>1</sup> For Allah is your Guardian. And He is the All-Knowing, All-Wise.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ أَسَرَّ ٱلنَّبِىُّ إِلَىٰ بَعْضِ أَزْوَٰجِهِۦ حَدِيثًا فَلَمَّا نَبَّأَتْ بِهِۦ وَأَظْهَرَهُ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ عَرَّفَ بَعْضَهُۥ وَأَعْرَضَ عَنۢ بَعْضٍ ۖ فَلَمَّا نَبَّأَهَا بِهِۦ قَالَتْ مَنْ أَنۢبَأَكَ هَـٰذَا ۖ قَالَ نَبَّأَنِىَ ٱلْعَلِيمُ ٱلْخَبِيرُ
verses.english: ˹Remember˺ when the Prophet had ˹once˺ confided something to one of his wives, then when she disclosed it ˹to another wife˺ and Allah made it known to him, he presented ˹to her˺ part of what was disclosed and overlooked a part. So when he informed her of it, she exclaimed, “Who told you this?” He replied, “I was informed by the All-Knowing, All-Aware.”

verses.arabic: إِن تَتُوبَآ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ فَقَدْ صَغَتْ قُلُوبُكُمَا ۖ وَإِن تَظَـٰهَرَا عَلَيْهِ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ مَوْلَىٰهُ وَجِبْرِيلُ وَصَـٰلِحُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ ۖ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ ظَهِيرٌ
verses.english: ˹It will be better˺ if you ˹wives˺ both turn to Allah in repentance, for your hearts have certainly faltered. But if you ˹continue to˺ collaborate against him, then ˹know that˺ Allah Himself is his Guardian. And Gabriel, the righteous believers, and the angels are ˹all˺ his supporters as well.

verses.arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّهُۥٓ إِن طَلَّقَكُنَّ أَن يُبْدِلَهُۥٓ أَزْوَٰجًا خَيْرًا مِّنكُنَّ مُسْلِمَـٰتٍ مُّؤْمِنَـٰتٍ قَـٰنِتَـٰتٍ تَـٰٓئِبَـٰتٍ عَـٰبِدَٰتٍ سَـٰٓئِحَـٰتٍ ثَيِّبَـٰتٍ وَأَبْكَارًا
verses.english: Perhaps, if he were to divorce you ˹all˺, his Lord would replace you with better wives who are submissive ˹to Allah˺, faithful ˹to Him˺, devout, repentant, dedicated to worship and fasting—previously married or virgins.

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ قُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَكُمْ وَأَهْلِيكُمْ نَارًا وَقُودُهَا ٱلنَّاسُ وَٱلْحِجَارَةُ عَلَيْهَا مَلَـٰٓئِكَةٌ غِلَاظٌ شِدَادٌ لَّا يَعْصُونَ ٱللَّهَ مَآ أَمَرَهُمْ وَيَفْعَلُونَ مَا يُؤْمَرُونَ
verses.english: O believers! Protect yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is people and stones, overseen by formidable and severe angels, who never disobey whatever Allah orders—always doing as commanded.

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَا تَعْتَذِرُوا۟ ٱلْيَوْمَ ۖ إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.english: ˹The deniers will then be told,˺ “O disbelievers! Make no excuses this Day! You are only rewarded for what you used to do.”

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ تُوبُوٓا۟ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ تَوْبَةً نَّصُوحًا عَسَىٰ رَبُّكُمْ أَن يُكَفِّرَ عَنكُمْ سَيِّـَٔاتِكُمْ وَيُدْخِلَكُمْ جَنَّـٰتٍ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ يَوْمَ لَا يُخْزِى ٱللَّهُ ٱلنَّبِىَّ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مَعَهُۥ ۖ نُورُهُمْ يَسْعَىٰ بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَبِأَيْمَـٰنِهِمْ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَآ أَتْمِمْ لَنَا نُورَنَا وَٱغْفِرْ لَنَآ ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.english: O believers! Turn to Allah in sincere repentance, so your Lord may absolve you of your sins and admit you into Gardens, under which rivers flow, on the Day Allah will not disgrace the Prophet or the believers with him. Their light will shine ahead of them and on their right. They will say, “Our Lord! Perfect our light for us, and forgive us. ˹For˺ You are truly Most Capable of everything.”

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ جَـٰهِدِ ٱلْكُفَّارَ وَٱلْمُنَـٰفِقِينَ وَٱغْلُظْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ وَمَأْوَىٰهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
verses.english: O Prophet! Struggle against the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and be firm with them. Hell will be their home. What an evil destination!

verses.arabic: ضَرَبَ ٱللَّهُ مَثَلًا لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ ٱمْرَأَتَ نُوحٍ وَٱمْرَأَتَ لُوطٍ ۖ كَانَتَا تَحْتَ عَبْدَيْنِ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا صَـٰلِحَيْنِ فَخَانَتَاهُمَا فَلَمْ يُغْنِيَا عَنْهُمَا مِنَ ٱللَّهِ شَيْـًٔا وَقِيلَ ٱدْخُلَا ٱلنَّارَ مَعَ ٱلدَّٰخِلِينَ
verses.english: Allah sets forth an example for the disbelievers: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. Each was married to one of Our righteous servants, yet betrayed them.<sup foot_note=77527>1</sup> So their husbands were of no benefit to them against Allah whatsoever. Both were told, “Enter the Fire, along with the others!”

verses.arabic: تَبَـٰرَكَ ٱلَّذِى بِيَدِهِ ٱلْمُلْكُ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.english: Blessed is the One in Whose Hands rests all authority. And He is Most Capable of everything.

verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلْمَوْتَ وَٱلْحَيَوٰةَ لِيَبْلُوَكُمْ أَيُّكُمْ أَحْسَنُ عَمَلًا ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْغَفُورُ
verses.english: ˹He is the One˺ Who created death and life in order to test which of you is best in deeds. And He is the Almighty, All-Forgiving.

verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ سَبْعَ سَمَـٰوَٰتٍ طِبَاقًا ۖ مَّا تَرَىٰ فِى خَلْقِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ مِن تَفَـٰوُتٍ ۖ فَٱرْجِعِ ٱلْبَصَرَ هَلْ تَرَىٰ مِن فُطُورٍ
verses.english: ˹He is the One˺ Who created seven heavens, one above the other. You will never see any imperfection in the creation of the Most Compassionate.<sup foot_note=77529>1</sup> So look again: do you see any flaws?

verses.arabic: ثُمَّ ٱرْجِعِ ٱلْبَصَرَ كَرَّتَيْنِ يَنقَلِبْ إِلَيْكَ ٱلْبَصَرُ خَاسِئًا وَهُوَ حَسِيرٌ
verses.english: Then look again and again—your sight will return frustrated and weary.

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ زَيَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَآءَ ٱلدُّنْيَا بِمَصَـٰبِيحَ وَجَعَلْنَـٰهَا رُجُومًا لِّلشَّيَـٰطِينِ ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لَهُمْ عَذَابَ ٱلسَّعِيرِ
verses.english: And indeed, We adorned the lowest heaven with ˹stars like˺ lamps, and made them ˹as missiles˺ for stoning ˹eavesdropping˺ devils, for whom We have also prepared the torment of the Blaze.<sup foot_note=77530>1</sup>

verses.arabic: وَلِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِرَبِّهِمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
verses.english: Those who disbelieve in their Lord will suffer the punishment of Hell. What an evil destination!

verses.arabic: إِذَآ أُلْقُوا۟ فِيهَا سَمِعُوا۟ لَهَا شَهِيقًا وَهِىَ تَفُورُ
verses.english: When they are tossed into it, they will hear its roaring as it boils over,

verses.arabic: تَكَادُ تَمَيَّزُ مِنَ ٱلْغَيْظِ ۖ كُلَّمَآ أُلْقِىَ فِيهَا فَوْجٌ سَأَلَهُمْ خَزَنَتُهَآ أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ نَذِيرٌ
verses.english: almost bursting in fury. Every time a group is cast into it, its keepers will ask them, “Did a warner not come to you?”

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ بَلَىٰ قَدْ جَآءَنَا نَذِيرٌ فَكَذَّبْنَا وَقُلْنَا مَا نَزَّلَ ٱللَّهُ مِن شَىْءٍ إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا فِى ضَلَـٰلٍ كَبِيرٍ
verses.english: They will reply, “Yes, a warner did come to us, but we denied and said, ‘Allah has revealed nothing. You are extremely astray.’”

verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ لَوْ كُنَّا نَسْمَعُ أَوْ نَعْقِلُ مَا كُنَّا فِىٓ أَصْحَـٰبِ ٱلسَّعِيرِ
verses.english: And they will lament, “If only we had listened and reasoned, we would not be among the residents of the Blaze!”

verses.arabic: نٓ ۚ وَٱلْقَلَمِ وَمَا يَسْطُرُونَ
verses.english: Nũn. By the pen and what everyone writes!

verses.arabic: مَآ أَنتَ بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ بِمَجْنُونٍ
verses.english: By the grace of your Lord, you ˹O Prophet˺ are not insane.

verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ لَكَ لَأَجْرًا غَيْرَ مَمْنُونٍ
verses.english: You will certainly have a never-ending reward.

verses.arabic: وَإِنَّكَ لَعَلَىٰ خُلُقٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.english: And you are truly ˹a man˺ of outstanding character.

verses.arabic: فَسَتُبْصِرُ وَيُبْصِرُونَ
verses.english: Soon you and the pagans will see,

verses.arabic: بِأَييِّكُمُ ٱلْمَفْتُونُ
verses.english: which of you is mad.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
verses.english: Surely your Lord ˹alone˺ knows best who has strayed from His Way and who is ˹rightly˺ guided.

verses.arabic: فَلَا تُطِعِ ٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
verses.english: So do not give in to the deniers.

verses.arabic: وَدُّوا۟ لَوْ تُدْهِنُ فَيُدْهِنُونَ
verses.english: They wish you would compromise so they would yield ˹to you˺.

verses.arabic: وَلَا تُطِعْ كُلَّ حَلَّافٍ مَّهِينٍ
verses.english: And do not obey the despicable, vain oath-taker,

verses.arabic: ٱلْحَآقَّةُ
verses.english: The Inevitable Hour!

verses.arabic: مَا ٱلْحَآقَّةُ
verses.english: What is the Inevitable Hour?

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلْحَآقَّةُ
verses.english: And what will make you realize what the Inevitable Hour is?

verses.arabic: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ وَعَادٌۢ بِٱلْقَارِعَةِ
verses.english: ˹Both˺ Thamûd and ’Ȃd denied the Striking Disaster.<sup foot_note=77541>1</sup>

verses.arabic: فَأَمَّا ثَمُودُ فَأُهْلِكُوا۟ بِٱلطَّاغِيَةِ
verses.english: As for Thamûd, they were destroyed by an overwhelming blast.

verses.arabic: وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا۟ بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ
verses.english: And as for ’Ȃd, they were destroyed by a furious, bitter wind

verses.arabic: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَـٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى ٱلْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ
verses.english: which Allah unleashed on them non-stop for seven nights and eight days, so that you would have seen its people lying dead like trunks of uprooted palm trees.

verses.arabic: فَهَلْ تَرَىٰ لَهُم مِّنۢ بَاقِيَةٍ
verses.english: Do you see any of them left alive?

verses.arabic: وَجَآءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَن قَبْلَهُۥ وَٱلْمُؤْتَفِكَـٰتُ بِٱلْخَاطِئَةِ
verses.english: Also, Pharaoh and those before him, and ˹the people of˺ the overturned cities ˹of Lot˺ indulged in sin,

verses.arabic: فَعَصَوْا۟ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَّابِيَةً
verses.english: each disobeying their Lord’s messenger, so He seized them with a crushing grip.

verses.arabic: سَأَلَ سَآئِلٌۢ بِعَذَابٍ وَاقِعٍ
verses.english: A challenger<sup foot_note=77543>1</sup> has demanded a punishment bound to come

verses.arabic: لِّلْكَـٰفِرِينَ لَيْسَ لَهُۥ دَافِعٌ
verses.english: for the disbelievers—to be averted by none—

verses.arabic: مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ ذِى ٱلْمَعَارِجِ
verses.english: from Allah, Lord of pathways of ˹heavenly˺ ascent,

verses.arabic: تَعْرُجُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَيْهِ فِى يَوْمٍ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُۥ خَمْسِينَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ
verses.english: ˹through which˺ the angels and the ˹holy˺ spirit<sup foot_note=77544>1</sup> will ascend to Him on a Day fifty thousand years in length.<sup foot_note=77545>2</sup>

verses.arabic: فَٱصْبِرْ صَبْرًا جَمِيلًا
verses.english: So endure ˹this denial, O  Prophet,˺ with beautiful patience.

verses.arabic: إِنَّهُمْ يَرَوْنَهُۥ بَعِيدًا
verses.english: They truly see this ˹Day˺ as impossible,

verses.arabic: وَنَرَىٰهُ قَرِيبًا
verses.english: but We see it as inevitable.

verses.arabic: يَوْمَ تَكُونُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ كَٱلْمُهْلِ
verses.english: On that Day the sky will be like molten brass

verses.arabic: وَتَكُونُ ٱلْجِبَالُ كَٱلْعِهْنِ
verses.english: and the mountains like ˹tufts of˺ wool.

verses.arabic: وَلَا يَسْـَٔلُ حَمِيمٌ حَمِيمًا
verses.english: And no close friend will ask ˹about˺ their friends,

verses.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦٓ أَنْ أَنذِرْ قَوْمَكَ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِيَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.english: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people ˹saying to him˺, “Warn your people before a painful punishment comes to them.”

verses.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ إِنِّى لَكُمْ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.english: Noah proclaimed, “O my people! I am truly sent to you with a clear warning:

verses.arabic: أَنِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱتَّقُوهُ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.english: worship Allah ˹alone˺, fear Him, and obey me.

verses.arabic: يَغْفِرْ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمْ وَيُؤَخِّرْكُمْ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ ٱللَّهِ إِذَا جَآءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُ ۖ لَوْ كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.english: He will forgive your sins, and delay your end until the appointed time.<sup foot_note=77552>1</sup> Indeed, when the time set by Allah comes, it cannot be delayed, if only you knew!”

verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى دَعَوْتُ قَوْمِى لَيْلًا وَنَهَارًا
verses.english: He cried, “My Lord! I have surely called my people day and night,

verses.arabic: فَلَمْ يَزِدْهُمْ دُعَآءِىٓ إِلَّا فِرَارًا
verses.english: but my calls only made them run farther away.

verses.arabic: وَإِنِّى كُلَّمَا دَعَوْتُهُمْ لِتَغْفِرَ لَهُمْ جَعَلُوٓا۟ أَصَـٰبِعَهُمْ فِىٓ ءَاذَانِهِمْ وَٱسْتَغْشَوْا۟ ثِيَابَهُمْ وَأَصَرُّوا۟ وَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ ٱسْتِكْبَارًا
verses.english: And whenever I invite them to be forgiven by You, they press their fingers into their ears, cover themselves with their clothes, persist ˹in denial˺, and act very arrogantly.

verses.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنِّى دَعَوْتُهُمْ جِهَارًا
verses.english: Then I certainly called them openly,

verses.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنِّىٓ أَعْلَنتُ لَهُمْ وَأَسْرَرْتُ لَهُمْ إِسْرَارًا
verses.english: then I surely preached to them publicly and privately,

verses.arabic: فَقُلْتُ ٱسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ غَفَّارًا
verses.english: saying, ‘Seek your Lord’s forgiveness, ˹for˺ He is truly Most Forgiving.

verses.arabic: قُلْ أُوحِىَ إِلَىَّ أَنَّهُ ٱسْتَمَعَ نَفَرٌ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا سَمِعْنَا قُرْءَانًا عَجَبًا
verses.english: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “It has been revealed to me that a group of jinn listened ˹to the Quran,˺ and said ˹to their fellow jinn˺: ‘Indeed, we have heard a wondrous recitation.

verses.arabic: يَهْدِىٓ إِلَى ٱلرُّشْدِ فَـَٔامَنَّا بِهِۦ ۖ وَلَن نُّشْرِكَ بِرَبِّنَآ أَحَدًا
verses.english: It leads to Right Guidance so we believed in it, and we will never associate anyone with our Lord ˹in worship˺.

verses.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ تَعَـٰلَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا ٱتَّخَذَ صَـٰحِبَةً وَلَا وَلَدًا
verses.english: ˹Now, we believe that˺ our Lord—Exalted is His Majesty—has neither taken a mate nor offspring,

verses.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ شَطَطًا
verses.english: and that the foolish of us used to utter ˹outrageous˺ falsehoods about Allah.<sup foot_note=77556>1</sup>

verses.arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن تَقُولَ ٱلْإِنسُ وَٱلْجِنُّ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا
verses.english: We certainly thought that humans and jinn would never speak lies about Allah.

verses.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ رِجَالٌ مِّنَ ٱلْإِنسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٍ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمْ رَهَقًا
verses.english: And some men used to seek refuge with some jinn—so they increased each other in wickedness.<sup foot_note=77557>1</sup>

verses.arabic: وَأَنَّهُمْ ظَنُّوا۟ كَمَا ظَنَنتُمْ أَن لَّن يَبْعَثَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدًا
verses.english: And those ˹humans˺ thought, just like you ˹jinn˺, that Allah would not resurrect anyone ˹for judgment˺.

verses.arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَسْنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ فَوَجَدْنَـٰهَا مُلِئَتْ حَرَسًا شَدِيدًا وَشُهُبًا
verses.english: ˹Earlier˺ we tried to reach heaven ˹for news˺, only to find it filled with stern guards and shooting stars.<sup foot_note=77558>1</sup>

verses.arabic: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقْعُدُ مِنْهَا مَقَـٰعِدَ لِلسَّمْعِ ۖ فَمَن يَسْتَمِعِ ٱلْـَٔانَ يَجِدْ لَهُۥ شِهَابًا رَّصَدًا
verses.english: We used to take up positions there for eavesdropping, but whoever dares eavesdrop now will find a flare lying in wait for them.

verses.arabic: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدْرِىٓ أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ أَمْ أَرَادَ بِهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ رَشَدًا
verses.english: Now, we have no clue whether evil is intended for those on earth, or their Lord intends for them what is right.

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمُزَّمِّلُ
verses.english: O you wrapped ˹in your clothes˺!

verses.arabic: قُمِ ٱلَّيْلَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا
verses.english: Stand all night ˹in prayer˺ except a little—

verses.arabic: نِّصْفَهُۥٓ أَوِ ٱنقُصْ مِنْهُ قَلِيلًا
verses.english: ˹pray˺ half the night, or a little less,

verses.arabic: أَوْ زِدْ عَلَيْهِ وَرَتِّلِ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ تَرْتِيلًا
verses.english: or a little more—and recite the Quran ˹properly˺ in a measured way.

verses.arabic: إِنَّا سَنُلْقِى عَلَيْكَ قَوْلًا ثَقِيلًا
verses.english: ˹For˺ We will soon send upon you a weighty revelation.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ ٱلَّيْلِ هِىَ أَشَدُّ وَطْـًٔا وَأَقْوَمُ قِيلًا
verses.english: Indeed, worship in the night is more impactful and suitable for recitation.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ لَكَ فِى ٱلنَّهَارِ سَبْحًا طَوِيلًا
verses.english: For during the day you are over-occupied ˹with worldly duties˺.

verses.arabic: وَٱذْكُرِ ٱسْمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلْ إِلَيْهِ تَبْتِيلًا
verses.english: ˹Always˺ remember the Name of your Lord, and devote yourself to Him wholeheartedly.

verses.arabic: رَّبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقِ وَٱلْمَغْرِبِ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَٱتَّخِذْهُ وَكِيلًا
verses.english: ˹He is the˺ Lord of the east and the west. There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him, so take Him ˹alone˺ as a Trustee of Affairs.

verses.arabic: وَٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱهْجُرْهُمْ هَجْرًا جَمِيلًا
verses.english: Be patient ˹O Prophet˺ with what they say, and depart from them courteously.

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمُدَّثِّرُ
verses.english: O you covered up ˹in your clothes˺!

verses.arabic: قُمْ فَأَنذِرْ
verses.english: Arise and warn ˹all˺.

verses.arabic: وَرَبَّكَ فَكَبِّرْ
verses.english: Revere your Lord ˹alone˺.

verses.arabic: وَثِيَابَكَ فَطَهِّرْ
verses.english: Purify your garments.

verses.arabic: وَٱلرُّجْزَ فَٱهْجُرْ
verses.english: ˹Continue to˺ shun idols.

verses.arabic: وَلَا تَمْنُن تَسْتَكْثِرُ
verses.english: Do not do a favour expecting more ˹in return˺.<sup foot_note=77564>1</sup>

verses.arabic: وَلِرَبِّكَ فَٱصْبِرْ
verses.english: And persevere for ˹the sake of˺ your Lord.

verses.arabic: فَإِذَا نُقِرَ فِى ٱلنَّاقُورِ
verses.english: ˹For˺ when the Trumpet will be sounded,<sup foot_note=77565>1</sup>

verses.arabic: فَذَٰلِكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَوْمٌ عَسِيرٌ
verses.english: that will ˹truly˺ be a difficult Day—

verses.arabic: عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ غَيْرُ يَسِيرٍ
verses.english: far from easy for the disbelievers.

verses.arabic: لَآ أُقْسِمُ بِيَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ
verses.english: I do swear by the Day of Judgment!

verses.arabic: وَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِٱلنَّفْسِ ٱللَّوَّامَةِ
verses.english: And I do swear by the self-reproaching soul!

verses.arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ أَلَّن نَّجْمَعَ عِظَامَهُۥ
verses.english: Do people think We cannot reassemble their bones?

verses.arabic: بَلَىٰ قَـٰدِرِينَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّسَوِّىَ بَنَانَهُۥ
verses.english: Yes ˹indeed˺! We are ˹most˺ capable of restoring ˹even˺ their very fingertips.<sup foot_note=77569>1</sup>

verses.arabic: بَلْ يُرِيدُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ لِيَفْجُرَ أَمَامَهُۥ
verses.english: Still people want to deny what is yet to come,

verses.arabic: يَسْـَٔلُ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ
verses.english: asking ˹mockingly˺, “When is this Day of Judgment?”

verses.arabic: فَإِذَا بَرِقَ ٱلْبَصَرُ
verses.english: But when the sight is stunned,

verses.arabic: وَخَسَفَ ٱلْقَمَرُ
verses.english: and the moon is dimmed,

verses.arabic: وَجُمِعَ ٱلشَّمْسُ وَٱلْقَمَرُ
verses.english: and the sun and the moon are brought together,<sup foot_note=77570>1</sup>

verses.arabic: يَقُولُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ يَوْمَئِذٍ أَيْنَ ٱلْمَفَرُّ
verses.english: on that Day one will cry, “Where is the escape?”

verses.arabic: هَلْ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْإِنسَـٰنِ حِينٌ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهْرِ لَمْ يَكُن شَيْـًٔا مَّذْكُورًا
verses.english: Is there not a period of time when each human is nothing yet worth mentioning?<sup foot_note=77573>1</sup>

verses.arabic: إِنَّا خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ أَمْشَاجٍ نَّبْتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلْنَـٰهُ سَمِيعًۢا بَصِيرًا
verses.english: ˹For˺ indeed, We ˹alone˺ created humans from a drop of mixed fluids,<sup foot_note=77574>1</sup> ˹in order˺ to test them, so We made them hear and see.

verses.arabic: إِنَّا هَدَيْنَـٰهُ ٱلسَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرًا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا
verses.english: We already showed them the Way, whether they ˹choose to˺ be grateful or ungrateful.

verses.arabic: إِنَّآ أَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ سَلَـٰسِلَا۟ وَأَغْلَـٰلًا وَسَعِيرًا
verses.english: Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains, shackles, and a blazing Fire.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلْأَبْرَارَ يَشْرَبُونَ مِن كَأْسٍ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
verses.english: Indeed, the virtuous will have a drink ˹of pure wine˺—flavoured with camphor—

verses.arabic: عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفْجِيرًا
verses.english: ˹from˺ a spring where Allah’s servants will drink, flowing at their will.

verses.arabic: يُوفُونَ بِٱلنَّذْرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوْمًا كَانَ شَرُّهُۥ مُسْتَطِيرًا
verses.english: They ˹are those who˺ fulfil ˹their˺ vows and fear a Day of sweeping horror,

verses.arabic: وَيُطْعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسْكِينًا وَيَتِيمًا وَأَسِيرًا
verses.english: and give food—despite their desire for it—to the poor, the orphan, and the captive,

verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا نُطْعِمُكُمْ لِوَجْهِ ٱللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنكُمْ جَزَآءً وَلَا شُكُورًا
verses.english: ˹saying to themselves,˺ “We feed you only for the sake of Allah, seeking neither reward nor thanks from you.

verses.arabic: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوْمًا عَبُوسًا قَمْطَرِيرًا
verses.english: We fear from our Lord a horribly distressful Day.”

verses.arabic: وَٱلْمُرْسَلَـٰتِ عُرْفًا
verses.english: By those ˹winds˺ sent forth successively,

verses.arabic: فَٱلْعَـٰصِفَـٰتِ عَصْفًا
verses.english: and those blowing violently,

verses.arabic: وَٱلنَّـٰشِرَٰتِ نَشْرًا
verses.english: and those scattering ˹rainclouds˺ widely!

verses.arabic: فَٱلْفَـٰرِقَـٰتِ فَرْقًا
verses.english: And ˹by˺ those ˹angels˺ fully distinguishing ˹truth from falsehood˺,

verses.arabic: فَٱلْمُلْقِيَـٰتِ ذِكْرًا
verses.english: and those delivering revelation,

verses.arabic: عُذْرًا أَوْ نُذْرًا
verses.english: ending excuses and giving warnings.

verses.arabic: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَوَٰقِعٌ
verses.english: Surely, what you are promised will come to pass.

verses.arabic: فَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ طُمِسَتْ
verses.english: So when the stars are put out,

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ فُرِجَتْ
verses.english: and the sky is torn apart,

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْجِبَالُ نُسِفَتْ
verses.english: and the mountains are blown away,

verses.arabic: عَمَّ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
verses.english: What are they asking one another about?

verses.arabic: عَنِ ٱلنَّبَإِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
verses.english: About the momentous news,

verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِى هُمْ فِيهِ مُخْتَلِفُونَ
verses.english: over which they disagree.<sup foot_note=77581>1</sup>

verses.arabic: كَلَّا سَيَعْلَمُونَ
verses.english: But no! They will come to know.

verses.arabic: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَيَعْلَمُونَ
verses.english: Again, no! They will come to know.

verses.arabic: أَلَمْ نَجْعَلِ ٱلْأَرْضَ مِهَـٰدًا
verses.english: Have We not smoothed out the earth ˹like a bed˺,

verses.arabic: وَٱلْجِبَالَ أَوْتَادًا
verses.english: and ˹made˺ the mountains as ˹its˺ pegs,<sup foot_note=77582>1</sup>

verses.arabic: وَخَلَقْنَـٰكُمْ أَزْوَٰجًا
verses.english: and created you in pairs,

verses.arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا نَوْمَكُمْ سُبَاتًا
verses.english: and made your sleep for rest,

verses.arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا ٱلَّيْلَ لِبَاسًا
verses.english: and made the night as a cover,

verses.arabic: وَٱلنَّـٰزِعَـٰتِ غَرْقًا
verses.english: By those ˹angels˺ stripping out ˹evil souls˺ harshly,

verses.arabic: وَٱلنَّـٰشِطَـٰتِ نَشْطًا
verses.english: and those pulling out ˹good souls˺ gently,

verses.arabic: وَٱلسَّـٰبِحَـٰتِ سَبْحًا
verses.english: and those gliding ˹through heavens˺ swiftly,

verses.arabic: فَٱلسَّـٰبِقَـٰتِ سَبْقًا
verses.english: and those taking the lead vigorously,

verses.arabic: فَٱلْمُدَبِّرَٰتِ أَمْرًا
verses.english: and those conducting affairs ˹obediently˺!

verses.arabic: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ ٱلرَّاجِفَةُ
verses.english: ˹Consider˺ the Day ˹when˺ the quaking Blast will come to pass,<sup foot_note=77585>1</sup>

verses.arabic: تَتْبَعُهَا ٱلرَّادِفَةُ
verses.english: followed by a second Blast.

verses.arabic: قُلُوبٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَاجِفَةٌ
verses.english: ˹The deniers’˺ hearts on that Day will be trembling ˹in horror˺,

verses.arabic: أَبْصَـٰرُهَا خَـٰشِعَةٌ
verses.english: with their eyes downcast.

verses.arabic: يَقُولُونَ أَءِنَّا لَمَرْدُودُونَ فِى ٱلْحَافِرَةِ
verses.english: ˹But now˺ they ask ˹mockingly˺, “Will we really be restored to our former state,

verses.arabic: عَبَسَ وَتَوَلَّىٰٓ
verses.english: He frowned and turned ˹his attention˺ away,

verses.arabic: أَن جَآءَهُ ٱلْأَعْمَىٰ
verses.english: ˹simply˺ because the blind man came to him ˹interrupting˺.<sup foot_note=77591>1</sup>

verses.arabic: وَمَا يُدْرِيكَ لَعَلَّهُۥ يَزَّكَّىٰٓ
verses.english: You never know ˹O Prophet˺, perhaps he may be purified,

verses.arabic: أَوْ يَذَّكَّرُ فَتَنفَعَهُ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰٓ
verses.english: or he may be mindful, benefitting from the reminder.

verses.arabic: أَمَّا مَنِ ٱسْتَغْنَىٰ
verses.english: As for the one who was indifferent,

verses.arabic: فَأَنتَ لَهُۥ تَصَدَّىٰ
verses.english: you gave him your ˹undivided˺ attention,

verses.arabic: وَمَا عَلَيْكَ أَلَّا يَزَّكَّىٰ
verses.english: even though you are not to blame if he would not be purified.

verses.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَن جَآءَكَ يَسْعَىٰ
verses.english: But as for the one who came to you, eager ˹to learn˺,

verses.arabic: وَهُوَ يَخْشَىٰ
verses.english: being in awe ˹of Allah˺,

verses.arabic: فَأَنتَ عَنْهُ تَلَهَّىٰ
verses.english: you were inattentive to him.

verses.arabic: إِذَا ٱلشَّمْسُ كُوِّرَتْ
verses.english: When the sun is put out,

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ ٱنكَدَرَتْ
verses.english: and when the stars fall down,

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْجِبَالُ سُيِّرَتْ
verses.english: and when the mountains are blown away,

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْعِشَارُ عُطِّلَتْ
verses.english: and when pregnant camels are left untended,<sup foot_note=77595>1</sup>

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْوُحُوشُ حُشِرَتْ
verses.english: and when wild beasts are gathered together,<sup foot_note=77596>1</sup>

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْبِحَارُ سُجِّرَتْ
verses.english: and when the seas are set on fire,<sup foot_note=77597>1</sup>

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّفُوسُ زُوِّجَتْ
verses.english: and when the souls ˹and their bodies˺ are paired ˹once more˺,

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْمَوْءُۥدَةُ سُئِلَتْ
verses.english: and when baby girls, buried alive, are asked

verses.arabic: بِأَىِّ ذَنۢبٍ قُتِلَتْ
verses.english: for what crime they were put to death,<sup foot_note=77598>1</sup>

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلصُّحُفُ نُشِرَتْ
verses.english: and when the records ˹of deeds˺ are laid open,

verses.arabic: إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنفَطَرَتْ
verses.english: When the sky splits open,

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْكَوَاكِبُ ٱنتَثَرَتْ
verses.english: and when the stars fall away,

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْبِحَارُ فُجِّرَتْ
verses.english: and when the seas burst forth,

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْقُبُورُ بُعْثِرَتْ
verses.english: and when the graves spill out,

verses.arabic: عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَّا قَدَّمَتْ وَأَخَّرَتْ
verses.english: ˹then˺ each soul will know what it has sent forth or left behind.

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ ٱلْكَرِيمِ
verses.english: O humanity! What has emboldened you against your Lord, the Most Generous,

verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَكَ فَسَوَّىٰكَ فَعَدَلَكَ
verses.english: Who created you, fashioned you, and perfected your design,

verses.arabic: فِىٓ أَىِّ صُورَةٍ مَّا شَآءَ رَكَّبَكَ
verses.english: moulding you in whatever form He willed?

verses.arabic: كَلَّا بَلْ تُكَذِّبُونَ بِٱلدِّينِ
verses.english: But no! In fact, you deny the ˹final˺ Judgment,

verses.arabic: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكُمْ لَحَـٰفِظِينَ
verses.english: while you are certainly observed by vigilant,

verses.arabic: وَيْلٌ لِّلْمُطَفِّفِينَ
verses.english: Woe to the defrauders!

verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ٱكْتَالُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ يَسْتَوْفُونَ
verses.english: Those who take full measure ˹when they buy˺ from people,

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا كَالُوهُمْ أَو وَّزَنُوهُمْ يُخْسِرُونَ
verses.english: but give less when they measure or weigh for buyers.

verses.arabic: أَلَا يَظُنُّ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَنَّهُم مَّبْعُوثُونَ
verses.english: Do such people not think that they will be resurrected

verses.arabic: لِيَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.english: for a tremendous Day—

verses.arabic: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ ٱلنَّاسُ لِرَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.english: the Day ˹all˺ people will stand before the Lord of all worlds?

verses.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلْفُجَّارِ لَفِى سِجِّينٍ
verses.english: But no! The wicked are certainly bound for Sijjîn<sup foot_note=77604>1</sup> ˹in the depths of Hell˺—

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا سِجِّينٌ
verses.english: and what will make you realize what Sijjîn is?—

verses.arabic: كِتَـٰبٌ مَّرْقُومٌ
verses.english: a fate ˹already˺ sealed.<sup foot_note=77605>1</sup>

verses.arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
verses.english: Woe on that Day to the deniers—

verses.arabic: إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنشَقَّتْ
verses.english: When the sky bursts open,

verses.arabic: وَأَذِنَتْ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتْ
verses.english: obeying its Lord as it must,

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْأَرْضُ مُدَّتْ
verses.english: and when the earth is flattened out,

verses.arabic: وَأَلْقَتْ مَا فِيهَا وَتَخَلَّتْ
verses.english: and ejects ˹all˺ its contents<sup foot_note=77607>1</sup> and becomes empty,

verses.arabic: وَأَذِنَتْ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتْ
verses.english: obeying its Lord as it must, ˹surely you will all be judged˺.

verses.arabic: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدْحًا فَمُلَـٰقِيهِ
verses.english: O humanity! Indeed, you are labouring restlessly towards your Lord, and will ˹eventually˺ meet the consequences.

verses.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ
verses.english: As for those who are given their record in their right hand,

verses.arabic: فَسَوْفَ يُحَاسَبُ حِسَابًا يَسِيرًا
verses.english: they will have an easy reckoning,

verses.arabic: وَيَنقَلِبُ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِۦ مَسْرُورًا
verses.english: and will return to their people joyfully.

verses.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ وَرَآءَ ظَهْرِهِۦ
verses.english: And as for those who are given their record ˹in their left hand˺ from behind their backs,

verses.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلْبُرُوجِ
verses.english: By the sky full of constellations,

verses.arabic: وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْمَوْعُودِ
verses.english: and the promised Day ˹of Judgment˺,

verses.arabic: وَشَاهِدٍ وَمَشْهُودٍ
verses.english: and the witness and what is witnessed!<sup foot_note=77610>1</sup>

verses.arabic: قُتِلَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْأُخْدُودِ
verses.english: Condemned are the makers of the ditch—

verses.arabic: ٱلنَّارِ ذَاتِ ٱلْوَقُودِ
verses.english: the fire ˹pit˺, filled with fuel—

verses.arabic: إِذْ هُمْ عَلَيْهَا قُعُودٌ
verses.english: when they sat around it,

verses.arabic: وَهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفْعَلُونَ بِٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ شُهُودٌ
verses.english: watching what they had ˹ordered to be˺ done to the believers,

verses.arabic: وَمَا نَقَمُوا۟ مِنْهُمْ إِلَّآ أَن يُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْحَمِيدِ
verses.english: who they resented for no reason other than belief in Allah—the Almighty, the Praiseworthy—

verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِى لَهُۥ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ شَهِيدٌ
verses.english: ˹the One˺ to Whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and earth. And Allah is a Witness over all things.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ فَتَنُوا۟ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَـٰتِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَتُوبُوا۟ فَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ ٱلْحَرِيقِ
verses.english: Those who persecute the believing men and women and then do not repent will certainly suffer the punishment of Hell and the torment of burning.

verses.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلطَّارِقِ
verses.english: By the heaven and the nightly star!

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلطَّارِقُ
verses.english: And what will make you realize what the nightly star is?

verses.arabic: ٱلنَّجْمُ ٱلثَّاقِبُ
verses.english: ˹It is˺ the star of piercing brightness.

verses.arabic: إِن كُلُّ نَفْسٍ لَّمَّا عَلَيْهَا حَافِظٌ
verses.english: There is no soul without a vigilant angel ˹recording everything˺.

verses.arabic: فَلْيَنظُرِ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ مِمَّ خُلِقَ
verses.english: Let people then consider what they were created from!

verses.arabic: خُلِقَ مِن مَّآءٍ دَافِقٍ
verses.english: ˹They were˺ created from a spurting fluid,

verses.arabic: يَخْرُجُ مِنۢ بَيْنِ ٱلصُّلْبِ وَٱلتَّرَآئِبِ
verses.english: stemming from between the backbone and the ribcage.<sup foot_note=77611>1</sup>

verses.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ رَجْعِهِۦ لَقَادِرٌ
verses.english: Surely He is fully capable of bringing them back ˹to life˺

verses.arabic: يَوْمَ تُبْلَى ٱلسَّرَآئِرُ
verses.english: on the Day all secrets will be disclosed.

verses.arabic: فَمَا لَهُۥ مِن قُوَّةٍ وَلَا نَاصِرٍ
verses.english: Then one will have neither power nor ˹any˺ helper.

verses.arabic: سَبِّحِ ٱسْمَ رَبِّكَ ٱلْأَعْلَى
verses.english: Glorify the Name of your Lord, the Most High,

verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ
verses.english: Who created and ˹perfectly˺ fashioned ˹all˺,

verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِى قَدَّرَ فَهَدَىٰ
verses.english: and Who ordained precisely and inspired accordingly,

verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِىٓ أَخْرَجَ ٱلْمَرْعَىٰ
verses.english: and Who brings forth ˹green˺ pasture,

verses.arabic: فَجَعَلَهُۥ غُثَآءً أَحْوَىٰ
verses.english: then reduces it to withered chaff.

verses.arabic: سَنُقْرِئُكَ فَلَا تَنسَىٰٓ
verses.english: We will have you recite ˹the Quran, O  Prophet,˺ so you will not forget ˹any of it˺,

verses.arabic: إِلَّا مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ يَعْلَمُ ٱلْجَهْرَ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ
verses.english: unless Allah wills otherwise.<sup foot_note=77612>1</sup> He surely knows what is open and what is hidden.

verses.arabic: وَنُيَسِّرُكَ لِلْيُسْرَىٰ
verses.english: We will facilitate for you the Way of Ease.<sup foot_note=77613>1</sup>

verses.arabic: فَذَكِّرْ إِن نَّفَعَتِ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰ
verses.english: So ˹always˺ remind ˹with the Quran˺—˹even˺ if the reminder is beneficial ˹only to some˺.

verses.arabic: سَيَذَّكَّرُ مَن يَخْشَىٰ
verses.english: Those in awe ˹of Allah˺ will be mindful ˹of it˺.

verses.arabic: هَلْ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ٱلْغَـٰشِيَةِ
verses.english: Has the news of the Overwhelming Event reached you ˹O Prophet˺?

verses.arabic: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ خَـٰشِعَةٌ
verses.english: On that Day ˹some˺ faces will be downcast,

verses.arabic: عَامِلَةٌ نَّاصِبَةٌ
verses.english: ˹totally˺ overburdened, exhausted,

verses.arabic: تَصْلَىٰ نَارًا حَامِيَةً
verses.english: burning in a scorching Fire,

verses.arabic: تُسْقَىٰ مِنْ عَيْنٍ ءَانِيَةٍ
verses.english: left to drink from a scalding spring.

verses.arabic: لَّيْسَ لَهُمْ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِن ضَرِيعٍ
verses.english: They will have no food except a foul, thorny shrub,

verses.arabic: لَّا يُسْمِنُ وَلَا يُغْنِى مِن جُوعٍ
verses.english: neither nourishing nor satisfying hunger.

verses.arabic: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ نَّاعِمَةٌ
verses.english: On that Day ˹other˺ faces will be glowing with bliss,

verses.arabic: لِّسَعْيِهَا رَاضِيَةٌ
verses.english: ˹fully˺ pleased with their striving,

verses.arabic: فِى جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٍ
verses.english: in an elevated Garden,

verses.arabic: وَٱلْفَجْرِ
verses.english: By the dawn,<sup foot_note=77616>1</sup>

verses.arabic: وَلَيَالٍ عَشْرٍ
verses.english: and the ten nights,<sup foot_note=77617>1</sup>

verses.arabic: وَٱلشَّفْعِ وَٱلْوَتْرِ
verses.english: and the even and the odd,

verses.arabic: وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذَا يَسْرِ
verses.english: and the night when it passes!

verses.arabic: هَلْ فِى ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِّذِى حِجْرٍ
verses.english: Is all this ˹not˺ a sufficient oath for those who have sense?

verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
verses.english: Did you not see how your Lord dealt with ’Ȃd—

verses.arabic: إِرَمَ ذَاتِ ٱلْعِمَادِ
verses.english: ˹the people˺ of Iram—with ˹their˺ great stature,

verses.arabic: ٱلَّتِى لَمْ يُخْلَقْ مِثْلُهَا فِى ٱلْبِلَـٰدِ
verses.english: unmatched in any other land;

verses.arabic: وَثَمُودَ ٱلَّذِينَ جَابُوا۟ ٱلصَّخْرَ بِٱلْوَادِ
verses.english: and Thamûd who carved ˹their homes into˺ the rocks in the ˹Stone˺ Valley;

verses.arabic: وَفِرْعَوْنَ ذِى ٱلْأَوْتَادِ
verses.english: and the Pharaoh of mighty structures?<sup foot_note=77618>1</sup>

verses.arabic: لَآ أُقْسِمُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْبَلَدِ
verses.english: I do swear by this city ˹of Mecca˺—

verses.arabic: وَأَنتَ حِلٌّۢ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْبَلَدِ
verses.english: even though you ˹O Prophet˺ are subject to abuse in this city—

verses.arabic: وَوَالِدٍ وَمَا وَلَدَ
verses.english: and by every parent and ˹their˺ child!

verses.arabic: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ فِى كَبَدٍ
verses.english: Indeed, We have created humankind in ˹constant˺ struggle.

verses.arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ أَحَدٌ
verses.english: Do they think that no one has power over them,

verses.arabic: يَقُولُ أَهْلَكْتُ مَالًا لُّبَدًا
verses.english: boasting, “I have wasted enormous wealth!”?

verses.arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّمْ يَرَهُۥٓ أَحَدٌ
verses.english: Do they think that no one sees them?

verses.arabic: أَلَمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُۥ عَيْنَيْنِ
verses.english: Have We not given them two eyes,

verses.arabic: وَلِسَانًا وَشَفَتَيْنِ
verses.english: a tongue, and two lips;

verses.arabic: وَهَدَيْنَـٰهُ ٱلنَّجْدَيْنِ
verses.english: and shown them the two ways ˹of right and wrong˺?

verses.arabic: وَٱلشَّمْسِ وَضُحَىٰهَا
verses.english: By the sun and its brightness,

verses.arabic: وَٱلْقَمَرِ إِذَا تَلَىٰهَا
verses.english: and the moon as it follows it,<sup foot_note=77623>1</sup>

verses.arabic: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا جَلَّىٰهَا
verses.english: and the day as it unveils it,

verses.arabic: وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَىٰهَا
verses.english: and the night as it conceals it!

verses.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ وَمَا بَنَىٰهَا
verses.english: And by heaven and ˹the One˺ Who built it,

verses.arabic: وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا طَحَىٰهَا
verses.english: and the earth and ˹the One˺ Who spread it!

verses.arabic: وَنَفْسٍ وَمَا سَوَّىٰهَا
verses.english: And by the soul and ˹the One˺ Who fashioned it,

verses.arabic: فَأَلْهَمَهَا فُجُورَهَا وَتَقْوَىٰهَا
verses.english: then with ˹the knowledge of˺ right and wrong inspired it!

verses.arabic: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَن زَكَّىٰهَا
verses.english: Successful indeed is the one who purifies their soul,

verses.arabic: وَقَدْ خَابَ مَن دَسَّىٰهَا
verses.english: and doomed is the one who corrupts it!

verses.arabic: وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَىٰ
verses.english: By the night when it covers,

verses.arabic: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا تَجَلَّىٰ
verses.english: and the day when it shines!

verses.arabic: وَمَا خَلَقَ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلْأُنثَىٰٓ
verses.english: And by ˹the One˺ Who created male and female!

verses.arabic: إِنَّ سَعْيَكُمْ لَشَتَّىٰ
verses.english: Surely the ends you strive for are diverse.

verses.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أَعْطَىٰ وَٱتَّقَىٰ
verses.english: As for the one who is charitable, mindful ˹of Allah˺,

verses.arabic: وَصَدَّقَ بِٱلْحُسْنَىٰ
verses.english: and ˹firmly˺ believes in the finest reward,

verses.arabic: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُۥ لِلْيُسْرَىٰ
verses.english: We will facilitate for them the Way of Ease.

verses.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنۢ بَخِلَ وَٱسْتَغْنَىٰ
verses.english: And as for the one who is stingy, indifferent ˹to Allah˺,

verses.arabic: وَكَذَّبَ بِٱلْحُسْنَىٰ
verses.english: and ˹staunchly˺ denies the finest reward,

verses.arabic: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُۥ لِلْعُسْرَىٰ
verses.english: We will facilitate for them the path of hardship.

verses.arabic: وَٱلضُّحَىٰ
verses.english: By the morning sunlight,

verses.arabic: وَٱلَّيْلِ إِذَا سَجَىٰ
verses.english: and the night when it falls still!

verses.arabic: مَا وَدَّعَكَ رَبُّكَ وَمَا قَلَىٰ
verses.english: Your Lord ˹O Prophet˺ has not abandoned you, nor has He become hateful ˹of you˺.

verses.arabic: وَلَلْـَٔاخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ لَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْأُولَىٰ
verses.english: And the next life is certainly far better for you than this one.

verses.arabic: وَلَسَوْفَ يُعْطِيكَ رَبُّكَ فَتَرْضَىٰٓ
verses.english: And ˹surely˺ your Lord will give so much to you that you will be pleased.

verses.arabic: أَلَمْ يَجِدْكَ يَتِيمًا فَـَٔاوَىٰ
verses.english: Did He not find you as an orphan then sheltered you?

verses.arabic: وَوَجَدَكَ ضَآلًّا فَهَدَىٰ
verses.english: Did He not find you unguided then guided you?

verses.arabic: وَوَجَدَكَ عَآئِلًا فَأَغْنَىٰ
verses.english: And did He not find you needy then satisfied your needs?

verses.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلْيَتِيمَ فَلَا تَقْهَرْ
verses.english: So do not oppress the orphan,

verses.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلسَّآئِلَ فَلَا تَنْهَرْ
verses.english: nor repulse the beggar.<sup foot_note=77625>1</sup>

verses.arabic: أَلَمْ نَشْرَحْ لَكَ صَدْرَكَ
verses.english: Have We not uplifted your heart for you ˹O Prophet˺,

verses.arabic: وَوَضَعْنَا عَنكَ وِزْرَكَ
verses.english: relieved you of the burden

verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنقَضَ ظَهْرَكَ
verses.english: which weighed so heavily on your back,

verses.arabic: وَرَفَعْنَا لَكَ ذِكْرَكَ
verses.english: and elevated your renown for you?<sup foot_note=77626>1</sup>

verses.arabic: فَإِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
verses.english: So, surely with hardship comes ease.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ مَعَ ٱلْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
verses.english: Surely with ˹that˺ hardship comes ˹more˺ ease.<sup foot_note=77627>1</sup>

verses.arabic: فَإِذَا فَرَغْتَ فَٱنصَبْ
verses.english: So once you have fulfilled ˹your duty˺, strive ˹in devotion˺,

verses.arabic: وَإِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَٱرْغَب
verses.english: turning to your Lord ˹alone˺ with hope.

verses.arabic: وَٱلتِّينِ وَٱلزَّيْتُونِ
verses.english: By the fig and the olive ˹of Jerusalem˺,

verses.arabic: وَطُورِ سِينِينَ
verses.english: and Mount Sinai,

verses.arabic: وَهَـٰذَا ٱلْبَلَدِ ٱلْأَمِينِ
verses.english: and this secure city ˹of Mecca˺!<sup foot_note=77628>1</sup>

verses.arabic: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ فِىٓ أَحْسَنِ تَقْوِيمٍ
verses.english: Indeed, We created humans in the best form.

verses.arabic: ثُمَّ رَدَدْنَـٰهُ أَسْفَلَ سَـٰفِلِينَ
verses.english: But We will reduce them to the lowest of the low ˹in Hell˺,

verses.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ فَلَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ
verses.english: except those who believe and do good—they will have a never-ending reward.

verses.arabic: فَمَا يُكَذِّبُكَ بَعْدُ بِٱلدِّينِ
verses.english: Now, what makes you deny the ˹final˺ Judgment?

verses.arabic: أَلَيْسَ ٱللَّهُ بِأَحْكَمِ ٱلْحَـٰكِمِينَ
verses.english: Is Allah not the most just of all judges?

verses.arabic: ٱقْرَأْ بِٱسْمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ
verses.english: Read, ˹O Prophet,˺ in the Name of your Lord Who created—

verses.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مِنْ عَلَقٍ
verses.english: created humans from a clinging clot.<sup foot_note=77629>1</sup>

verses.arabic: ٱقْرَأْ وَرَبُّكَ ٱلْأَكْرَمُ
verses.english: Read! And your Lord is the Most Generous,

verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِى عَلَّمَ بِٱلْقَلَمِ
verses.english: Who taught by the pen—
